success.description: Object name. Must be unique in the domain.

success.name: connection-persistence
success.description: Handling established connections when installing a new policy.

success.name: forward-to-other-sam-servers
success.description: Forward SAM clients' requests to other SAM servers.

success.name: purge-when-size-reaches-to
success.description: Purge SAM File When it Reaches to.

success.name: global-settings-mode
success.description: Whether to override global settings or not.

success.name: fail-mode
success.description: Fail mode - allow or block all requests.

success.name: auto-topology-use-custom-recalculation-time
success.description: Auto topology to use custom recalculation time instead of default.

success.name: auto-generate-ip
success.description: Use an automatically generated IP address for the Gateway object (applies only to Smart-1 Cloud).

success.name: authentication-token
success.description: Authentication token to use on the Gateway side to establish the communication between the Gateway and the Management Server (applies o Smart-1 Cloud).

success.name: ip
success.description: IP address used for communication between the Gateway and the Management Server (used when 'auto-generate-ip=true').

success.name: status
success.description: Status of communication between the Gateway and the Management Server.

success.name: gateway-mac-address
success.description: Use the Security Gateway MAC address, relevant for the gateway_mac_address identification-method.

success.name: identification-method
success.description: How to identify the gateway (relevant for DAIP gateways only).

success.name: status
success.description: Status of the trusted communication with the Security Gateway.

success.name: trust-method
success.description: Trust method that was used for establishing communication.

success.name: priority
success.description: In a High Availability New mode cluster each machine is given a priority. The highest priority machine serves as the gateway in normal circumstances. If this machine fails, control is passed to the next highest priority machine. If that machine fails, control is passed to the next machine, and so on. In Load Sharing Unicast mode cluster, the highest priority is the pivot machine. The values must be in a range from 1 to N, where N is number of cluster members.

success.name: color
success.description: Color of the object. Should be one of existing colors.

success.name: member-recovery-mode
success.description: In a High Availability cluster, each member is given a priority. The member with the highest priority serves as the gateway. If this gateway fails, control is passed to the member with the next highest priority. If that member fails, control is passed to the next, and so on. Upon gateway recovery, it is possible to: Maintain current active Cluster Member (maintain-current-active) or Switch to higher priority Cluster Member (according-to-priority).

success.name: delayed
success.description: Start synchronizing with delay of seconds, as defined by delayed-seconds, after connection initiation. Disabled when state-synchronization disabled.

success.name: delayed-seconds
success.description: Start synchronizing X seconds after connection initiation . The values must be in a range between 2 and 3600.

success.name: track-changes-of-cluster-members
success.description: Track changes in the status of Cluster Members.

success.name: use-virtual-mac
success.description: Use Virtual MAC. By enabling Virtual MAC in ClusterXL High Availability New mode, or Load Sharing Unicast mode, all cluster members associate the same Virtual MAC address with All Cluster Virtual Interfaces and the Virtual IP address.

success.name: override-profile
success.description: Whether to override the Server (Check Point Host) object configuration.

success.name: value
success.description: according-to-topology: Use the original or translated IP address of the server based on the Topology of Security Gateway interfaces.original-ip-only: Use only the original IP address of the servertranslated-ip-only: Use only the translated IP address of the server.

success.name: enable-https-inspection
success.description: Enable HTTPS Inspection after defining an outbound inspection certificate. To define the outbound certificate use "set outbound-inspection-certificate".

success.name: fetch-policy
success.description: Security management server(s) to fetch the policy from.

success.name: geo-mode
success.description: Cluster High Availability Geo mode.This setting applies only to a cluster deployed in a cloud. Available when the cluster mode equals "cluster-xl-ha".
